meanings.definition: Make or become dark or darker in color.
meanings.sent1: The storm clouds darkened the sky.
meanings.sent2: The room darkened as the sun set.
meanings.sent3: The magician darkened the white rabbit, turning it into a black one!
meanings.sent4: His mood darkened like a thundercloud before the storm.
meanings.sent5: The forest darkened with the approach of night, casting shadows all around.

meanings.definition: Make or become gloomy or somber.
meanings.sent2: The darkened room matched his somber thoughts.
meanings.sent3: The clown's attempt at a serious face only darkened the mood of the party.
meanings.sent4: His face darkened with sadness as he listened to the tragic story.
meanings.sent5: The darkened sky mirrored her gloomy outlook on life.

meanings.definition: Make or become less hopeful or optimistic.
meanings.sent1: The constant failures darkened his view of the future.
meanings.sent2: The darkened outlook on the situation made it hard to see a positive outcome.
meanings.sent3: Even the cheerful music couldn't darken his pessimistic attitude.
meanings.sent4: The darkened clouds of doubt loomed over his once bright dreams.
meanings.sent5: The darkened shadows of doubt crept into her once hopeful heart.
